column4: Why would I keep getting a bad header error when I try to install anything under 9.04?
can you pastebin the entire error message?
http://pastebin.com/me338e2a
that's strange, can you open any of those URLs in your web browser?
if i just enter one of those URLs in my browser, it does a google search on it and displays results
what do you need, anyway?
I'm backing up my home folder to a fat drive and frostburn says I might want the userids in order to get permissions working when I import from the backup.
when you copy something to a FAT drive, it loses all permissions and owner and group.
unless you use 'tar' or something like that, of course.
anyway, when you restore the files, you can just do "ls -l" on a user's directory, note the UID shown, then just add a new user with the same UID.

What I've done so far is to individually back up the two user directories from /home. Will I be able to bring them back and drop them in /home after I reinstall? or do I have to back up /home as a whole?

just want to know if I'm going to be really really sorry if I copied my two user directories separately out of /home to a fat drive or should I start over? The filesystem on the drive isn't really able to be changed right now unless I partition it, which I don't know how to do. Can I just go ahead as I am and come back here for help with permissions afterward or is that asking for trouble?
on nano, you just press Ctrl-X to exit.
I'm using visudo
visudo just calls your default editor.
does it say "GNU nano" on the first line?
*slaps forehead* yeah it does. But I don't know how to use nano either.
nano is the simplest one.
just use arrow keys, and type. Use Ctrl-X to exit.
http://packages.ubuntu.com/
thanks.
Most of the time, compiling is easy... doesn't Evolution have an "import" option?
Evolution has an import option, but it doesn't include .dbx
